required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021

clinical_study.brief_title: Nitrite Infusion in Islet Cell Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Nitrite Infusion in Islet Cell Transplantation: Test of Clinical Efficacy and Determination of Cytoprotective Mechanisms

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to investigate the effects of administering nitrite to pancreatic islet cells that have been removed from a patient for autotransplantation.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients diagnosed with chronic pancreatitis or recurrent acute pancreatitis may acquire insulin-dependent diabetes due to islet cell destruction. Therefore, islet cell autotransplantation is the optimal therapeutic approach for many of these patients. Islet cell autotransplantation is typically done by excision of the pancreas, followed by isolation of the islet cells and then infusion of these cells into the sinusoids of the liver. Isolation of the islet cells occurs in an ischemic and hypoxic environment, resulting in ischemia reperfusion (IR) injury and destruction of islet cells following infusion into the sinusoids. Hence, strategies to prevent IR injury and subsequent islet cell destruction, such as the administration of inhaled nitric oxide (NO) or sodium nitrite (NaNO2) could enhance islet cell survival following reperfusion, also decreasing long-term insulin requirement. The purpose of this study is to determine if NO administered by infusion in patients undergoing islet cell auto transplantation, will inhibit islet cell destruction, increase diabetes cure rate (decrease the amount of and/or the need for long-term insulin requirement), decrease the ischemic injury (reduces the injury to the islet cells from a decrease in oxygen levels during procurement of the islet cells) during islet cell procurement, and decrease IR injury following islet cell infusion. The primary endpoints of the study are exogenous insulin use, HgbA1c levels post-operatively, and blood glucose levels.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Lack of eligible subjects, lack of staffing

primary_outcome.measure: Prior to Infusion Blood Glucose Serum Levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: Between the time of induction and the time immediately prior to infusion of either nitrite or saline
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: Pre-islet Cell Infusion Blood Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: Five minutes prior to the infusion of islet cells
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: 20 Minutes After Islet Cells Blood Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: 20 minutes after the infusion of Islet Cells
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: 40 Minutes After Islet Cells Blood Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.time_frame: 40 minutes after the infusion of Islet Cells
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: 24 Hours Post Operative Blood Samples Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: 48 Hours Post Operative Blood Samples Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: 72 Hours Post Operative Blood Samples Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

primary_outcome.measure: 96 Hours Post Operative Blood Samples Serum Glucose Levels
primary_outcome.description: Blood serum glucose levels will be measured from a blood sample of the amount of 3-5 cc.

intervention.description: A saline infusion will be administered during the pre-isolation and post-isolation phases.
A nitrite infusion will be administered during the pre-isolation phase and a saline infusion will be administered during the post-isolation phase.
A saline infusion will be administered during the pre-isolation phase and a nitrite infusion will be administered during the reperfusion phase.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients greater than or equal to 18 years of age
- Scheduled to undergo Islet Cell auto-transplantation by Dr. Jared White or Dr. Bart Rose
- Subjects who can provide informed written consent and are willing to do so
Exclusion Criteria:
-Any patient with liver disease or unsuitable for surgery (as determined by the surgeon)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
